result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin James Skram was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Surcharge], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: To be paid during the terms of probation

Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by Agent. This to include AODA counseling and Domestic Violence Counseling.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin James Skram

records.addlTxt: Re: Attorney's Court Appointed Cost Statement
Order for Payment  re: attorney's court appointed cost statement

11:02 AM Defendant Kevin James Skram in court.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Kevin James Skram.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Amended Information filed. Guilty Plea entered. Defendant advised of U.S. non-citizen collateral consequences resulting in deportation, the exclusion of admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law. Defendant advised of firearm restriction. The Court finds the defendant guilty of count 1. Withhold sentence, 2 years of probation. Concurrent to any other sentence currently being served. Defendant advised of post conviction relief. Defendant to report to probation.

records.addlTxt: 09:31 AM Kevin James Skram, defendant appeared in Court in person without counsel. Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. DE did not apply for State Public Defender but states he knows he will not qualify.  Defendant referred to apply with Judge's office for Court Appointed Attorney. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Matter set over for status to give defendant time to get an attorney. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
